RACE.RACE_TEXT: HASTINGS RACE 1 6 1/2F Dirt CR: 70. Maiden Optional Claiming Purse 20000. FOR MAIDENS, FILLIES AND MARES THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Claiming Price $50,000, if for $45,000, allowed 2 lbs. British Columbia Bred Claiming Price $57,500.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: LICORICE away alertly and stalked the leader into the backstretch while saving ground at the rail, eased off the rail in the run down the backside to take up the chase, rallied smarty two wide entering the final turn, swept to the lead leaving the turn, and held QUEENS OVER JACK'S safely at bay in the stretch drive under confident handling. QUEENS OVER JACK'S settled off the early pace while racing one out from the rail entering the first turn, began to advance midway down the backstretch, commenced her bid three wide entering the final turn, and closed willingly two out from the rail in the drive to prove clearly second best. SWANGIN broke sharply and raced to the lead from along the rail entering the first turn, dictated the pace in the run down the backside, battled into the final turn from the inside of LICORICE entering the final turn, was quickly overtaken leaving the turn, and was outfinished in the drive. ANZAC BAY settled off the early pace while saving ground at the rail entering the first turn, launched her bid from along the rail entering the final turn, steadied when in tight quarters at the rail in mid stretch, and struggled to regained her momentum late. DARLA'S FURY away well and stalked the leader into the backstretch while racing one out from the rail, dropped back to trail in the run to the final turn, and had nothing to offer over the final furlong. Following the running of this race there was a stewards inquiry into the start as was as an incident in mid stretch. After review there was no change to the original order of finish

ENTRY.NAME: Swangin
ENTRY.COMMENT: broke sharply, led rail, rallied inside, faded

ENTRY.NAME: Anzac Bay
ENTRY.COMMENT: settled rail, rallied inside, steadied 1/16

ENTRY.NAME: Darla's Fury
ENTRY.COMMENT: away well, stalked 2 wide, weakened

ENTRY.NAME: Licorice
ENTRY.COMMENT: away alertly, stalked rail, rallied 2 wide, led, held

WINNERS_DETAILS.BREEDER: Gladys Dittloff, Karen Dittloff, DaveGregory & Sylvea Greg

ENTRY.NAME: Queens Over Jack's
ENTRY.COMMENT: settled 2 wide, rallied 3 wide, closed 3 wide, 2nd best

RACE.RACE_TEXT: HASTINGS RACE 2 6 1/2F Dirt CR: 57. Claiming Purse 11000. (PLUS UP TO $5,500 THRIF) FOR FILLIES AND MARES THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON TWO RACES. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Since June 8 Allowed 2 lbs. A Race Since May 8 Allowed 4 lbs. Claiming Price $4,00 0, For Each $500 To $3,000 2 lbs. 3 Year olds Claiming $6,000 (BC Bred $7500). British Columbia Bred Claiming Price $5,000.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: ROSE OF TEXAS away alertly and dueled for the lead from the outside of GWEN entering the first turn, battled with that rival in the run down the backside, took control approaching the final turn, and was never seriously threatened late. DRILL BABY DRILL away well and stalked the contested early pace while saving ground at the rail entering the backstretch, rallied smartly from along the rail entering the final turn, waited briefly before shifting off the rail entering the lane, and closed willingly two wide in the drive to get up for the place. GWEN broke sharply and vied for the lead from along the rail entering the first turn, battled for the lead in the run down the backside, was unable to match strides with ROSE OF TEXAS approaching the final turn, rallied two wide through the turn, and finished five wide in the drive, and just failed to hold the place. PERFECT PENNY stalked the leaders into the backstretch while racing one out from the rail, rallied three wide entering the final turn, and finished two wide in the drive to just miss the place. ISLAND LIVING stalked the leaders in the run down the backside while racing two out from the rail, rallied four wide entering the final turn, and weakened over the final furlong.

ENTRY.NAME: Drill Baby Drill
ENTRY.OWNER: Danard Don B and Snow Mel
ENTRY.COMMENT: away well, stalked rail, rallied inside, closed 2 wide,

ENTRY.NAME: Gwen
ENTRY.COMMENT: broke sharply, vied rail, rallied 2 wide, closed 5 wide,

ENTRY.NAME: Perfect Penny
ENTRY.COMMENT: stalked 2 wide, rallied 3 wide, closed 2 wide,

ENTRY.NAME: Rose of Texas
ENTRY.OWNER: Danard Don B and Snow Mel
ENTRY.COMMENT: away alertly, dueled 2 wide, led, held

ENTRY.NAME: Island Living
ENTRY.COMMENT: stalked 3 wide, rallied 4 wide, weakened

RACE.RACE_TEXT: HASTINGS RACE 3 1 1/16M Dirt CR: 88. Claiming Purse 13500. (PLUS UP TO $7,000 THRIF) FOR THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race At A Mile Or Over Since June 8 Allowed 2 lbs. Such A Race Since May 8 Allowed 4 lbs. Claiming Price $10,000, if for $8,000, allowed 2 lbs. British Columbia Bred Claiming Price $12,500.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: FAMILY BIZ unhurried early while dropping back to trail, launched his bid five wide entering the final turn, and finished determinedly four wide in the drive to prove best. LAUGH WITH ME pressed the pace two wide from between rivals through the stretch the first time, continued to battle for the lead in the run down the backside and into the final turn, and continued bravely from along the rail in the drive to get the pace in a solid effort. MY COLLEGE FUND stalked the contested early pace while racing one out from the rail through the stretch the first time, maintained his position in the run down the backside, rallied four wide entering the final turn, and closed willingly two wide in the drive to garner a share. BLACK METAL away alertly and pressed the pace while hung three wide into the stretch the first time, continued to force the issue two out from the rail in the run down the backside and into the final turn, took a brief lead leaving the turn, but was outfinished late. PARKER POINT broke sharply and set a pressured pace from along the rail entering the stretch the first time, continued to set the pace from along the rail to the final turn, before weakening.

ENTRY.NAME: Parker Point
ENTRY.OWNER: Musgrove Donald H and Johnson Lyle
ENTRY.COMMENT: broke sharply, led rail, rallied inside, faded

ENTRY.NAME: Laugh With Me
ENTRY.COMMENT: pressed 2 wide, rallied 2 wide, closed rail

ENTRY.NAME: My College Fund
ENTRY.COMMENT: stalked 2 wide, rallied 4 wide, closed 2 wide,

ENTRY.NAME: Family Biz
ENTRY.COMMENT: unhurried early, trailed, rallied 5 wide, closed 4 wide,

ENTRY.NAME: Black Metal
ENTRY.COMMENT: away alertly, pressed 3 wide, rallied 3 wide, led, outfinished

RACE.RACE_TEXT: HASTINGS RACE 4 6 1/2F Dirt CR: 77. Allowance Optional Claiming Purse 17000. FOR FILLIES AND MARES THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON TWO RACES OR CLAIMING PRICE $12,500. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Since June 8 Allowed 2 lbs. A Race Since May 8 Allowed 4 lbs. Claiming Price $12,5 00, For Each $1,250 To $10,000 2 lbs. British Columbia Bred Claiming Price $15,000.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: QUEEN OF ATTITUDE hesitated at the start to get away slowly, and trailed the field into the backstretch, rallied smartly two wide into the final turn, and split horses in mid stretch to take command and draw clear late. KOALA away alertly and raced to the lead from along the rail entering the backstretch, set a pressured pace in the run down the backside and into the final turn, held a narrow advantage into the lane, and gave way grudgingly late. VIVA LA VINO away well and stalked the contested early pace into the backstretch while racing one out from the rail, rallied two wide entering the final turn, shifted four wide leaving the turn, and finished evenly to garner a share. LASTING LIGHT broke sharply and engaged the leader two wide soon after entering the backstretch, forced the issue two wide in the run down the backside and into the final turn, but was outfinished in deep stretch while finishing three wide. BELLAROO stalked the early pace while racing three wide entering the backstretch, rallied two out from the rail entering the final turn, but lacked the needed closing response when called upon. ADDENDUM stalked the early pace while saving ground at the rail entering the backstretch, rallied along the inside entering the final turn, and finished from along the rail in the drive while unable to mount a serious late bid.

ENTRY.NAME: Lasting Light
ENTRY.COMMENT: broke sharply, pressed 2 wide, rallied 2 wide, outfinished late

ENTRY.NAME: Addendum
ENTRY.OWNER: Freedom Farms Ltd Oliver Wayne and Tom Peter
ENTRY.COMMENT: stalked rail, rallied inside, needed more

ENTRY.NAME: Viva La Vino
ENTRY.COMMENT: away well, stalked 2 wide, rallied 2 wide, closed 4 wide,

ENTRY.NAME: Bellaroo
ENTRY.COMMENT: stalked 3 wide, rallied 3 wide, closed 2 wide,

ENTRY.NAME: Queen of Attitude
ENTRY.COMMENT: hesitated start, trailed, rallied 2 wide, closed 2 wide,

ENTRY.NAME: Koala
ENTRY.COMMENT: away alertly, led rail, rallied inside, gave way grudgingly

RACE.RACE_TEXT: HASTINGS RACE 5 6 1/2F Dirt CR: 81. Claiming Purse 12000. (PLUS UP TO $6,000 THRIF) FOR THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD THREE YEAR OLDS, 120 LBS.; OLDER, 124 LBS. Non-winners Of A Race Since June 8 Allowed 2 lbs. ; A Race Since May 8 Allowed 4 lbs. Claiming Price $6,250, For Each $625 To $5,000 2 lbs. BC Bred Claimi ng Price $8,000.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: COUNTRY COWBOY broke sharply and stalked the leaders into the backstretch while racing one out from the rail, rallied smartly three wide through the final turn, and finished willingly four wide in the drive to prove best. WISE MARKET away well and settled off the early pace while racing one out from the rail entering the backstretch, rallied three wide entering the final turn, and finished five wide in the drive to get up for the place. VALUABLE COWBOY dueled for the lead from the outside of DRILLER entering the first turn, forced the issue two wide in the run down the backside and into the final turn, continued to battle for the lead into the lane, but was outfinished late while holding on for a share. DRILLER rushed up from along the rail to vie for the lead entering the first turn, set a pressured pace from along the rail in the run down the backside and through the final turn, but faded in the late stages. STAR ENTRY unhurried early while dropping back to trail, rallied along the inside entering the final turn, and finished with late interest four wide in the drive. FOOT SOLDIER away alertly and stalked the battling leaders in the run down the backstretch, rallied from just off the rail through the final turn, shifted four wide in mid stretch and was forced to steady off heels, and lost all momentum. Following the running of this race there was a stewards and riders inquiry into an incident in mid stretch. The rider of FOOT SOLDIER lodged a claim of foul against the rider of COUNTRY COWBOY, for alleged interference in mid stretch. After review the claim of foul was disallowed and no change was made to the original order of finish.

ENTRY.NAME: Driller
ENTRY.OWNER: Danard Don B and Snow Mel
ENTRY.COMMENT: vied rail, rallied inside, late fade

ENTRY.NAME: Valuable Cowboy
ENTRY.COMMENT: dueled 2 wide, rallied 2 wide, closed 2 wide, outfinished

ENTRY.NAME: Wise Market
ENTRY.COMMENT: away well, settled 2 wide, rallied 3 wide, closed 5 wide,

ENTRY.NAME: Foot Soldier
ENTRY.COMMENT: away alertly, stalked rail, rallied inside, checked 1/16

ENTRY.NAME: Country Cowboy
ENTRY.COMMENT: broke sharply, stalked 2 wide, rallied 3 wide, closed 4 wide,

ENTRY.NAME: Star Entry
ENTRY.COMMENT: unhurried early, trailed, rallied inside, closed 4 wide,

RACE.RACE_TEXT: HASTINGS RACE 6 1 1/16M Dirt CR: 44. Maiden Claiming Purse 11000. (PLUS UP TO $5,500 THRIF) FOR MAIDENS, THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Claiming Price $4,000, For Each $500 To $3,000 2 lbs. British Columbia Bred Claiming Price $5,000.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: STRIKING VALUE hesitated at the start to get away slowly, settled well off the early pace while saving ground at the rail through the stretch the first time, began to advance from along the rail midway down the backstretch, rallied along the inside entering the final turn, and closed three wide from between rivals in deep stretch to get up in time. MOUNT LOKI tracked the early pace from along the inside through the stretch the first time, rallied smartly three wide through the final turn, and closed determinedly four wide in the drive to just miss. HARBOUR STORM away well and was allowed to settle off the early pace while racing two out from the rail through the stretch the first time, launched her bid two wide approaching the final turn, took a narrow advantage leaving the turn, but was outfinished in the late stages while grabbing a share. SWEET AS HONEY stalked the leaders from along the rail entering the stretch the first time, maintained a striking position in the run down the backstretch, rallied four wide entering the final turn, and finished two wide in the drive. LILSISTERLEE away alertly and raced to the lead from along the rail entering the first turn, set a pressured pace in the run down the backstretch and into the final turn, was overtaken entering the lane, and outfinished late. BE SPARKY settled off the early pace while racing two wide through the stretch the first time, rallied three wide entering the final turn, but failed to make a late impact when called upon. BECKAS BOY broke sharply and pressed the pace two wide through the stretch the first time, continued to force the issue in the run down the backside, took up approaching the final turn, and had nothing to offer late. OKANAGAN GOLD dwelt at the start, to get left well behind the field in the run to the first turn, was never in contact with the field, and not persevered with. The stewards conducted a review of the start following the race. After review there was no change to the original order of finish. The final time for this race was hand timed

ENTRY.NAME: Mount Loki
ENTRY.COMMENT: tracked rail, rallied 3 wide, closed 4 wide,

ENTRY.NAME: Lilsisterlee
ENTRY.COMMENT: away alertly, led rail, rallied inside, faded

ENTRY.NAME: Beckas Boy
ENTRY.OWNER: Barroby Harold J and Barroby Mrs Harold J
ENTRY.COMMENT: broke sharply, pressed 2w, took up 1/4, lacked response

ENTRY.NAME: Striking Value
ENTRY.COMMENT: hesitated start, settled, rallied rail, closed 3 wide,

ENTRY.NAME: Be Sparky
ENTRY.COMMENT: settled 2 wide, rallied 3 wide, lacked response

ENTRY.NAME: Sweet as Honey
ENTRY.COMMENT: stalked rail, rallied 4 wide, closed 2 wide,

ENTRY.NAME: Okanagan Gold
ENTRY.COMMENT: dwelt, trailed throughout, eased

ENTRY.NAME: Harbour Storm
ENTRY.OWNER: Wilson Warren Stajkowski Neil Sutherland June Switzer G Ross and Hickman Barry
ENTRY.COMMENT: away well, settled 3 wide, rallied 2 wide, led, outfinished

RACE.RACE_TEXT: HASTINGS RACE 7 1 1/16M Dirt CR: 83. Claiming Purse 12000. (PLUS UP TO $6,000 THRIF) FOR THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Since June 8 Allowed 2 lbs. A Race Since May 8 Allowed 4 lbs. Claiming Price $6,250, For Each $625 To $5,000 2 lbs. British Columbia Bred Claiming Price $8,000.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: BROKE AN BROKEN away well and vied for the lead from along the rail entering the stretch for the first time, was eased off the leaders to grab a tracking trip at the rail entering the second turn, rallied smartly from just off the rail through the final turn, tipped three wide entering the lane, and closed under confident handling to prove best. MR. QUALITY broke sharply and dueled two wide from between rivals entering the stretch the first time, set a pressured pace from along the rail in the run down the backside, rallied from along the rail entering the final turn, was unable to fend off the late surge of BROKE AN BROKEN in deep stretch, but battled gamely to hold the place. MAKEITORBREAKIT away alertly and pressed the early pace three wide entering the stretch the first time, battled for the lead from the outside of MR. QUALITY in the run down the backstretch and through the final turn, and battled determinedly two wide through the lane. GORKY PARK tracked the leader from along the inside entering the stretch the first time, commenced his bid from along the rail entering the final turn, and finished from along the rail in the drive. APPELLANT stalked the leaders into the stretch the first time while racing two out from the rail, raced into a tracking trip entering the backside, rallied three wide entering the final turn, to loom a danger, but was unable to sustain his bid late while finishing four wide in the drive. GOOD BYE PUTIN unhurried early while trailing the field into the stretch the first time, bided his time at the back of the pack entering the second turn, commenced his bid three wide while angling five wide midway through the final turn, and finished with late interest six wide in the drive. JUST MAKE BELIEVE stalked the early pace while racing two out from the rail entering the stretch the first time, commenced his bid three wide entering the final turn, but failed to mount a serious late bid when called upon. DON WITH THE WIND settled well off the early pace while saving ground at the rail entering the stretch the first time, was always well back and showed little. AVE'S IN COMMAND settled well off the early pace while racing one out from the rail entering the stretch the first time, was always well back and failed to make an impact.

ENTRY.NAME: Good Bye Putin
ENTRY.COMMENT: unhurried early, trailed, rallied 3 wide, closed 6 wide,

ENTRY.NAME: Don With the Wind
ENTRY.COMMENT: settled rail, showed little

ENTRY.NAME: Ave's in Command
ENTRY.COMMENT: settled 2 wide, showed little

ENTRY.NAME: Broke an Broken
ENTRY.COMMENT: away well, vied rail, tracked inside, rallied 2w, closed 3 wide,

ENTRY.NAME: Mr. Quality
ENTRY.COMMENT: broke sharply, dueled 2w, vied rail, rallied inside, closed rail

ENTRY.NAME: Makeitorbreakit
ENTRY.COMMENT: away alertly, pressed 3w, dueled 2w, rallied 2w, closed 2 wide,

ENTRY.NAME: Just Make Believe
ENTRY.OWNER: Last Call Racing Stable and Bornn Cathy
ENTRY.COMMENT: stalked 3 wide, rallied 3 wide, closed 3 wide,

ENTRY.NAME: Appellant
ENTRY.COMMENT: stalked 2w, tracked 2w, rallied 3w, closed 4 wide,

ENTRY.NAME: Gorky Park
ENTRY.COMMENT: tracked inside, rallied inside, closed rail
